snippet: Mokhtar Belmokhtar, who claimed responsibility for the January attack that killed three Americans, is being sought by prosecutors for a trial in Manhattan.
abstract: Mokhtar Belmokhtar, man who authorities say masterminded attack at Algerian gas plant in January that killed three Americans and dozens of other hostages and kidnappers, has been charged by federal prosecutors and is being sought for trial in Manhattan; charges are example of Obama administration's policy of seeking to try suspected terrorists in civilian courts in United States whenever feasible.
lead_paragraph: Mokhtar Belmokhtar, who claimed responsibility for the January attack that killed three Americans, is being sought by prosecutors for a trial in Manhattan.

headline.main: U.S. Charges Algerian in Deadly Gas Plant Attack
headline.print_headline: U.S. Charges Algerian In Attack at Gas Plant
